original: gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye dang / gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las bya'o //
analyzed: gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye dang / gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las bya'o //
translated: They should perform the poṣadha, the lifting of restrictions, the proposal, the proposal and two-part karma, and the proposal and four-part karma.

original: de ni las byed pa gcig gis tshig gcig gis mtshams gnyis cig car bcad pa'i cho ga dang las so //
analyzed: de ni las byed pa gcig gis tshig gcig gis mtshams gnyis cig car bcad pa'i cho ga dang las so //
translated: This is the ritual and karma of one ritual performer simultaneously defining two boundaries with one statement.

original: gso sbyong gi gzhi las mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi gnas kyi skabs nas las byed pa gcig gis tshig gcig gis mtshams gnyis cig car bcad nas de'i 'og tu mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyi chos gos dag dang mi 'bral ba'i gnang ba sbyin
analyzed: gso sbyong gi gzhi las mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi gnas kyi skabs nas las byed pa gcig gis tshig gcig gis mtshams gnyis cig car bcad nas de'i 'og tu mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyi chos gos dag dang mi 'bral ba'i gnang ba sbyin
translated: In the section on the basis of the poṣadha and the site of the concordant poṣadha, it is said that one ritual performer should simultaneously define two boundaries with one statement, and then afterwards, in the great boundary, permission should be given for all the monks not to be separated from their robes.

original: par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it should be done.

original: mtshams bu chung gi nang nas phyir byung ste /
analyzed: mtshams bu chung gi nang nas phyir byung ste /
translated: Having come out from inside the small boundary,

original: mtshams chen por gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la @204a * //
analyzed: mtshams chen por gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la @204a * //
translated: Having prepared the sleeping places in the great enclosure, having struck the gavel, and having asked with the words of inquiry,

original: yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: yang dag par bsgo nas /
translated: he should fully inform the monks.

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //🔽'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o // 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: When the entire Saṅgha is seated and in agreement, a monk should make a proposal and perform the rite.🔽This is how it should be done.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Sitting, he should say this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: 'di lta ste gnas 'dir dge 'dun mthun pas gso sbyong gcig pa'i gnas kyi sngom pas mtshams chen po bcad pa las /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gnas 'dir dge 'dun mthun pas gso sbyong gcig pa'i gnas kyi sngom pas mtshams chen po bcad pa las /
translated: In this way, the Saṅgha, in agreement, has delimited a great enclosure with the vow of a single observance-purification in this place.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis 'di lta ste gnas bsdu ba dang / dge slong rnams bde ba la reg par gnas par bgyi ba'i slad du mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyi chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba stsal to //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis 'di lta ste gnas bsdu ba dang / dge slong rnams bde ba la reg par gnas par bgyi ba'i slad du mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyi chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba stsal to //
translated: The Saṅgha is giving permission that the robes of all the monks not be separated from the great enclosure, in order to gather together the Saṅgha and to make the monks feel at ease.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: las ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The action is as follows:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Virtuous ones, listen!

original: 'di lta ste gnas 'dir dge 'dun mthun pas gso sbyong gcig pa'i gnas kyi sngom pas mtshams chen po bcad de /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gnas 'dir dge 'dun mthun pas gso sbyong gcig pa'i gnas kyi sngom pas mtshams chen po bcad de /
translated: In this place, the Saṅgha, in harmony, has established a great enclosure with the vow of a single Upoṣadha observance.

original: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i slad du dge 'dun gyis 'di lta ste /
translated: For that reason, the Saṅgha is giving permission that the robes of all the monks not be separated from the great enclosure,🔽in order to gather together the Saṅgha and to make the monks feel at ease.

original: gnas bsdu ba dang / dge slong rnams bde ba la reg par gnas par bgyi ba'i slad du mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyis chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba gsol na /
analyzed: gnas bsdu ba dang / dge slong rnams bde ba la reg par gnas par bgyi ba'i slad du mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyis chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba gsol na /
translated: In order to gather the saṅgha together and in order that the monks may dwell at ease, we ask for permission that all the monks not be separated from their robes within the large boundary.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerables, those who can agree

original: gnas bsdu ba dang / dge slong rnams bde ba la reg par gnas par bgyi ba'i slad du mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyis chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba stsal bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod
analyzed: gnas bsdu ba dang / dge slong rnams bde ba la reg par gnas par bgyi ba'i slad du mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyis chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba stsal bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod
translated: that in order to gather the saṅgha together and in order that the monks may dwell at ease, we should give permission that all the monks not be separated from their robes within the large boundary should remain silent.

original: pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas /
analyzed: pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas /
translated: Those who do not agree should speak.🔽The saṅgha has agreed and given permission

original: dge 'dun gyis mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyis chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba stsal lags te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyis chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba stsal lags te /
translated: that all the monks not be separated from their robes within the large boundary.

original: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar cang mi gsung bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to //
translated: Since the Saṅgha has remained silent, this is how I understand it.”

original: dge 'dun gyis gang du mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong rnams kyi chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba byin pa der dge slong rnams stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang bcas pas 'dong bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gang du mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong rnams kyi chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba byin pa der dge slong rnams stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang bcas pas 'dong bar bya ste /
translated: “The Saṅgha has given permission for the monks to go there with their robes, without being separated from their robes, within the large enclosure.

original: 'di @204b la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di @204b la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not have any doubts about this.”

original: de ni las byed pa gcig gis tshig gcig gis mtshams gnyis cig car bcad nas de'i 'og tu mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyi chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las so //
analyzed: de ni las byed pa gcig gis tshig gcig gis mtshams gnyis cig car bcad nas de'i 'og tu mtshams chen po'i nang du dge slong thams cad kyi chos gos dag dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnang ba sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las so //
translated: This is the procedure for the action and the rite of giving permission for the monks to go there with their robes, without being separated from their robes, within the large enclosure, after one who is performing the action has cut the two enclosures at the same time with one statement.

original: mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnas su ni las la rtsig pas bskor ba yin na rtsig pa mtshams yin na /
analyzed: mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnas su ni las la rtsig pas bskor ba yin na rtsig pa mtshams yin na /
translated: “In a place where the enclosure has not been cut, if the site for the action is surrounded by a wall, the wall is the enclosure.

original: rtsig pas ma bskor na wa kha nas chu 'dzag pa gang du bab pa chun cad mtshams yin no //
analyzed: rtsig pas ma bskor na wa kha nas chu 'dzag pa gang du bab pa chun cad mtshams yin no //
translated: If it is not surrounded by a wall, the enclosure is the area within the drip line of the wall.”

original: grong la ni nye 'khor kyi mtha' tshun cad mtshams yin no //
analyzed: grong la ni nye 'khor kyi mtha' tshun cad mtshams yin no //
translated: The boundary of a village extends as far as its outskirts.

original: dgon pa la ni phyogs su rgyang grags kyi mtha' tshun cad mtshams yin te /
analyzed: dgon pa la ni phyogs su rgyang grags kyi mtha' tshun cad mtshams yin te /
translated: The boundary of a wilderness area extends as far as one can shout in any direction.🔽If monks are staying within these boundaries, they should gather there to perform the poṣadha, the lifting of restrictions, and the four types of formal procedures:

original: dge slong mtshams de dag gi nang na 'khod pa rnams kyis der 'dug la gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye dang / gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mtshams de dag gi nang na 'khod pa rnams kyis der 'dug la gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye dang / gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las bya'o //
translated: those requiring a single announcement, those requiring a single announcement followed by a single proclamation, and those requiring a single announcement followed by three proclamations.

original: mi mthun par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro /🔽// / bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: mi mthun par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro / // / bam po bdun pa /
translated: If they do not do so, they become guilty of an offense.

original: gso sbyong gi gzhi las mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi tshogs pa'i skabs nas /
analyzed: gso sbyong gi gzhi las mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi tshogs pa'i skabs nas /
translated: The chapter on the basis of the poṣadha ceremony, the section on the assembly for the poṣadha ceremony that is in agreement, states:

original: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid mtshams kyi nang na dge slong na ba dang dbang med pa dang srog dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad gyi rkyen gyis gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du bar mi nus pa yod na dag nyid yongs su dag par bya ba'i
analyzed: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid mtshams kyi nang na dge slong na ba dang dbang med pa dang srog dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad gyi rkyen gyis gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du bar mi nus pa yod na dag nyid yongs su dag par bya ba'i
translated: If on the fifteenth day of the waning phase of the moon, which is the poṣadha day, there are sick or incapacitated monks or monks who are unable to attend the poṣadha ceremony because of circumstances that would endanger their life or their pure conduct, those monks who are pure should declare their purity.

original: phyir de'i yongs su dag pa blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: phyir de'i yongs su dag pa blang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The ritual for taking the purification is as follows.

original: dge slong yongs su dag pa len pa gcig gis yongs su dag pa 'bul ba gcig dang gnyis dang rab tu mang po rnams kyi yang rung ste /
analyzed: dge slong yongs su dag pa len pa gcig gis yongs su dag pa 'bul ba gcig dang gnyis dang rab tu mang po rnams kyi yang rung ste /
translated: A single monk who is taking the purification should take the purification of a single monk who is offering the purification, or of two or many monks.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang du ji snyed kyi ming dag brjod par nus pa'i bar dag gi yongs su dag pa blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang du ji snyed kyi ming dag brjod par nus pa'i bar dag gi yongs su dag pa blang bar bya'o //
translated: He should take the purification of as many monks as he can name in the midst of the saṅgha.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: He should do this.

original: dge skos kyis gso sbyong gi tshe tshul shing brim pas dge slong rnams bgrang zhing ma lhags pa dngos su yod dam /
analyzed: dge skos kyis gso sbyong gi tshe tshul shing brim pas dge slong rnams bgrang zhing ma lhags pa dngos su yod dam /
translated: When the virtue of the purification is being distributed by the disciplinarian, the monks count the number of monks present.🔽If there is a dispute about whether or not there are any monks who are absent, or whether there are any who have come in from outside, and so on, then on that very fifteenth day of the purification, the entire saṅgha should gather in the place where the work is done.

original: glo bur du 'ongs pa la sogs pa yod par 'khrigs na gso sbyong bcva lnga pa de nyid la dge 'dun thams cad las kyi gnas su tshogs pas dge slong yongs su dag pa len pa chos lnga dang ldan pa gcig gam gnyis sam gsum tshig gis bsko🔽bar bya zhing /
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pa la sogs pa yod par 'khrigs na gso sbyong bcva lnga pa de nyid la dge 'dun thams cad las kyi gnas su tshogs pas dge slong yongs su dag pa len pa chos lnga dang ldan pa gcig gam gnyis sam gsum tshig gis bsko🔽bar bya zhing /
translated: One, two, or three monks who are taking the purification should be appointed by the saṅgha.

original: des btsal ba dang bod pa dang mthon por 'dug ste phyogs su lta ba la sogs pa dag gis @205a * //
analyzed: des btsal ba dang bod pa dang mthon por 'dug ste phyogs su lta ba la sogs pa dag gis @205a * //
translated: He should search for them, and if he sees that they are Tibetan or high ranking, he should look in the direction of the boundary.🔽If they are not present, he should ask, “Venerables, are you completely pure with regard to the obstructions to the poṣadha?”

original: bsam pa thag pa nas mtshams kyi nang btsal te ma lhags pa rnams la deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad na tshe dang ldan pa bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag gam zhes dri bar bya zhing ma lhags pa rnams kyis de la yongs su dag pa
analyzed: bsam pa thag pa nas mtshams kyi nang btsal te ma lhags pa rnams la deng dge 'dun gso sbyong mdzad na tshe dang ldan pa bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag gam zhes dri bar bya zhing ma lhags pa rnams kyis de la yongs su dag pa
translated: Those who are not present should declare their purity

original: dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbul bar bya'o //
translated: to him.

original: dge slong yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pa'i kun tu spyod pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pa'i kun tu spyod pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The procedure for offering complete purity to a monk is as follows.

original: dge slong yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pas mchil lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: dge slong yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pas mchil lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te /
translated: The monk who is offering complete purity should remove his two shoes, put his upper robe over one shoulder,

original: rgan pa la phyag byas nas tsog tsog por 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgan pa la phyag byas nas tsog tsog por 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: bow down to the senior monks, squat, place his ten fingers together, and say the following:

original: che dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: che dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerables, please give your full attention.

original: deng dge 'dun gyis gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyis gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
translated: Today is the fifteenth day of the poṣadha of the saṅgha.

original: bdag dge slong blo 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
analyzed: bdag dge slong blo 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa lags te /
translated: I, the bhikṣu named so-and-so, who is sick, suffering, and gravely ill, am also on the fifteenth day of the poṣadha.

original: bdag dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes bdag mchi'o //
analyzed: bdag dge slong bro 'tshal ba sdug bsngal ba bro tshabs che ba ming 'di zhes bgyi ba bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag go zhes bdag mchi'o //
translated: I, the bhikṣu named so-and-so, who is sick, suffering, and gravely ill, am pure with regard to the matters that give rise to obstacles.

original: bdag gi gso sbyong yang yongs su dag ste /🔽yongs su dag pa yang brjod do //
analyzed: bdag gi gso sbyong yang yongs su dag ste / yongs su dag pa yang brjod do //
translated: My poṣadha is also pure.🔽I have declared my purity.

original: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do //
analyzed: brjod pa yang rig par bgyid do //
translated: I have made known my purity.

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /🔽dge slong yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pas gal te de skad brjod mi nus na lus sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas / dge slong yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed pas gal te de skad brjod mi nus na lus sam /
translated: Repeat this three times.

original: ngag gam / lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed na /
analyzed: ngag gam / lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed na /
translated: If the bhikṣu who is offering his purity is unable to speak in this way, he may offer his purity by means of physical or verbal expression or by means of physical and verbal expression.

original: yongs su dag pa phul bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa phul bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he does so, his purity is said to have been offered.

original: lus sam / ngag gam /
analyzed: lus sam / ngag gam /
translated: By means of physical or verbal expression or

original: lus dang ngag gi rnam par byed kyis yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed mi nus na dge 'dun thams cad der 'dong zhing gso sbyong bya ba'am /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi rnam par byed kyis yongs su dag pa 'bul bar byed mi nus na dge 'dun thams cad der 'dong zhing gso sbyong bya ba'am /
translated: If he is unable to offer it by means of physical or verbal action, then all the members of the community should go there and perform the poṣadha.

original: yang na dge slong de dge 'dun gyi nang du blangs te gso sbyong bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dge slong de dge 'dun gyi nang du blangs te gso sbyong bya'o //
translated: Or else, that monk should be brought into the midst of the community and the poṣadha performed.

original: dge slong yongs su dag pa len pa'i kun du spyod pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong yongs su dag pa len pa'i kun du spyod pa'i chos ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The rules of training for receiving the pure confession of a monk are as follows.

original: dge spyod yongs su dag pa len pas yongs su dag pa blangs nas brgyug par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: dge spyod yongs su dag pa len pas yongs su dag pa blangs nas brgyug par mi bya zhing /
translated: The one who receives the pure confession of a monk should not run while receiving it.

original: mgyogs par mi bya /
analyzed: mgyogs par mi bya /
translated: He should not do it quickly.

original: mtshang par mi bya /
analyzed: mtshang par mi bya /
translated: He should not do it carelessly.

original: phyi rol la mchong bar mi bya /🔽'obs la mchong bar mi bya /
analyzed: phyi rol la mchong bar mi bya / 'obs la mchong bar mi bya /
translated: He should not jump over an outer wall.🔽He should not jump into a moat.

original: bang rim la mchong bar mi bya /
analyzed: bang rim la mchong bar mi bya /
translated: He should not jump over a terrace.

original: steng gi nam mkha' la 'dug par mi bya /
analyzed: steng gi nam mkha' la 'dug par mi bya /
translated: He should not sit in the sky above.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro bar @205b mi bya ;
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro bar @205b mi bya ;
translated: He should not go outside the boundary.

original: gom pa gcig gis skas kyi rim pa gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya /
analyzed: gom pa gcig gis skas kyi rim pa gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya /
translated: He should not ascend two steps of a staircase with a single step.

original: gom pa gcig gis them skas kyi them pa gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya /
analyzed: gom pa gcig gis them skas kyi them pa gnyis la thod rgal du 'dzeg par mi bya /
translated: One should not skip two steps of a staircase with one step.

original: chu lkog ma nub tsam la 'bog par mi bya /
analyzed: chu lkog ma nub tsam la 'bog par mi bya /
translated: One should not enter the water up to the Adam’s apple.

original: gnyid log par mi bya /
analyzed: gnyid log par mi bya /
translated: One should not fall asleep.

original: snyoms par 'jug par mi bya bar dge 'dun gyi nang du 'jug par bya zhing /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug par mi bya bar dge 'dun gyi nang du 'jug par bya zhing /
translated: One should not enter into meditative absorption.🔽When the elder of the saṅgha says, “Venerables, please declare the purity of those who are absent.

analyzed: sbyong gi tshogs pa'i skabs nas dge slong smyos pa mi mthun pa byed pa la smyos pa'i gnang ba sbyin par bya'o //

original: zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /

original: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /
analyzed: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas gand'i brdungs te dris pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams la yang dag par bsgo nas /

analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa la dge slong gcig gis gsol ba byas te las bya'o //

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it is done.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol //

analyzed: dge slong bye ma skyes 'di sgren mor byung nas smyos shing sems 'khrugs te /

analyzed: de dang der 'khyam zhing dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong gi gnas su res 'ga' ni mchi /

original: res 'ga' ni mi mchi /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mi mchi /

original: res 'ga' ni nyams su myong bar mi bgyid /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni nyams su myong bar mi bgyid /

original: dge 'dun gyi ched dang bgyi ba rnams la res 'ga' ni mchi /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi ched dang bgyi ba rnams la res 'ga' ni mchi /

analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na /
translated: If the Saṅgha’s time has come and it is agreeable,🔽then the Saṅgha should give permission for the Saṅgha to give the permission of insanity to the monk Bhadrika who is insane.

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong bye ma skyes smyos pa la smyos pa'i gnang ba stsal zhing gal te tshur mchi yang bzlog par mi bgyid /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong bye ma skyes smyos pa la smyos pa'i gnang ba stsal zhing gal te tshur mchi yang bzlog par mi bgyid /

original: phar mchi yang bzlog par mi bgyi bar dge slong bye ma skyes tshur mchi 'am phar mchi yang rung /
analyzed: phar mchi yang bzlog par mi bgyi bar dge slong bye ma skyes tshur mchi 'am phar mchi yang rung /

analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye dang / gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las bgyi ste /

analyzed: des dge 'dun mi mthun par mi 'gyur ro //

original: res 'ga' ni mi mchi /

translated: if we say, ‘We are not in agreement,’ and do not do the work,

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang dag dge slong bye ma skyes smyos pa la smyos pa'i gnang ba stsal bar bzod pa de dag ni cang ma gsung shig / gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni gsungs shig / dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas dge 'dun gyis
translated: Those who do not agree, should speak.🔽The Saṅgha has agreed and assented to

analyzed: dge slong bye ma skyes smyos pa la smyos pa'i gnang ba stsal lags te /

analyzed: de ni smyos pa'i gnang ba sbyin pa'i cho ga dang las so //
translated: This is the rite and the action for granting permission to be insane.

analyzed: gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la dge slong gnyug mar gnas pa 'ga' zhig rgyal po la sogs pas bzung ste /
translated: On that very fifteenth day of the confession ceremony, some resident monks were seized by the king and so on.

original: mtshams kyi nang na 'dug na pho nya btang ba la sogs pas de dang mthun pa sgrub pa'i phyir 'bad par bya ba dang / dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa 'ga' zhig mtshams kyi nang na 'dug par 'phrigs na btsal ba dang / bong ba dang /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na 'dug na pho nya btang ba la sogs pas de dang mthun pa sgrub pa'i phyir 'bad par bya ba dang / dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa 'ga' zhig mtshams kyi nang na 'dug par 'phrigs na btsal ba dang / bong ba dang /
translated: If one is certain that some newly arrived monks are inside the boundary, one should search for them.🔽If one is sitting high up and looking around, one should make an effort to accomplish that by looking around.

original: mthon por 'dug ste phyogs su lta ba dag gis de dang mthun par sgrub pa'i phyir 'bad par bya ba dang / mtshams gcig gi nang du tshogs tha dad pas las tha dad pa mang po so son byed na 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa phan tshun dbul ba dag gis de dang mthun pa sgrub pa'i phyir 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: mthon por 'dug ste phyogs su lta ba dag gis de dang mthun par sgrub pa'i phyir 'bad par bya ba dang / mtshams gcig gi nang du tshogs tha dad pas las tha dad pa mang po so son byed na 'dun pa dang yongs su dag pa phan tshun dbul ba dag gis de dang mthun pa sgrub pa'i phyir 'bad par bya'o //
translated: If many different groups within the same boundary are performing many different rites, one should make an effort to accomplish that by exchanging the expression of consent and purification.

original: de ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong la tshogs par bya ba'i cho ga'o //🔽gso sbyong gi gzhi las mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi @210a * //
analyzed: de ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong la tshogs par bya ba'i cho ga'o // gso sbyong gi gzhi las mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi @210a * //
translated: This is the ritual for the assembly to perform the Poṣadha of consent.🔽In the chapter on the basis of the Poṣadha,

original: cho ga'i skabs nas /
analyzed: cho ga'i skabs nas /
translated: in the section on the ritual of the Poṣadha of consent,🔽it says:

original: gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol kho nar gso sbyong snga ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed kyi ltung ba la so sor brtag cing ltung ba shes pa bshags pa'am /
analyzed: gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol kho nar gso sbyong snga ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed kyi ltung ba la so sor brtag cing ltung ba shes pa bshags pa'am /
translated: One should examine each of the downfalls that occurred during the previous half month before the observance day.🔽If one recognizes a downfall, one should restore the vow by confessing it,🔽by restraining oneself from future transgressions, or by consecrating the downfall.

original: bsdam pa'am / byin gyis brlabs pas phyir bcos te las kyi gnas su 'dug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: bsdam pa'am / byin gyis brlabs pas phyir bcos te las kyi gnas su 'dug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: Then one should go to the place where the ceremony is to be held.

original: gso sbyong zhes bya ba ni bslab pa gsum po dag gso zhing sbyong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gso sbyong zhes bya ba ni bslab pa gsum po dag gso zhing sbyong bar byed pa ste /
translated: The observance day is so called because it restores and purifies the three trainings.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis ste /
translated: It is of two kinds:

original: mthun pa'i gso sbyong dang / zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong ngo //
analyzed: mthun pa'i gso sbyong dang / zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong ngo //
translated: the observance day of compatibility and the observance day of serenity.

original: de la mthun pa'i gso sbyong ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te gnas dang tshogs pa dang cho ga mthun par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la mthun pa'i gso sbyong ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te gnas dang tshogs pa dang cho ga mthun par bya ba'o //
translated: The observance day of compatibility is the observance day that is performed in a suitable place, by a suitable group, and in a suitable manner, in order to maintain pure conduct.

original: zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong ni lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi dbang du byas te spong ba'i yan lag sgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong ni lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi dbang du byas te spong ba'i yan lag sgom pa'o //
translated: The purification of the basis of training in virtue is the cultivation of the branches of abandonment, in terms of superior thought and superior wisdom.

original: de yang las phyi ma rnams ni mi bya ba'i chu lon gyis bsdam pa yin pas de ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong gis sngom par byed do //
analyzed: de yang las phyi ma rnams ni mi bya ba'i chu lon gyis bsdam pa yin pas de ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong gis sngom par byed do //
translated: Moreover, since the latter actions are restrained by the dam of non-action, one is bound by the purification of the basis of training in virtue.

original: las snga ma rnams ni bsgom pa'i rnam pas sbyang ba yin pas de ni zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong gis sbyong bar byed de /🔽des na lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brten te lhag pa'i sems bskyed la /
analyzed: las snga ma rnams ni bsgom pa'i rnam pas sbyang ba yin pas de ni zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong gis sbyong bar byed de / des na lhag pa'i tshul khrims la brten te lhag pa'i sems bskyed la /
translated: Since the former actions are purified by the aspect of cultivation, one purifies by the purification of the basis of training in virtue.

original: lhag pa'i sems la brten te lhag pa'i shes rab skye bas bslab pa gsum po dag gso zhing sbyong ba ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong dang zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la brten te lhag pa'i shes rab skye bas bslab pa gsum po dag gso zhing sbyong ba ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong dang zhi gnas kyi gso sbyong yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that the purification of the basis of training in virtue and the purification of the basis of training in virtue are the purification of the three trainings, since one generates superior thought in dependence on superior morality, and one generates superior wisdom in dependence on superior thought.

original: skabs 'dir ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni mthun pa'i gso sbyong gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Here, one should take the purification of the basis of training in virtue.

original: mthun pa'i gso sbyong ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i gso sbyong ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The purification of the basis of training in virtue is fivefold:

original: bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang / bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / bsdum pa'i gso sbyong ngo //
analyzed: bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang / bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / bsdum pa'i gso sbyong ngo //
translated: and the purification and restoration of reconciliation.🔽The fourteenth and fifteenth purification and restoration are the twenty-four purifications and restorations that occur in the twelve months of the six seasons.

original: de la gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa ni dus tshigs drug po dag gis zla ba bcu gnyis la gso sbyong nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod pa las drug ni gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin la /
analyzed: de la gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa ni dus tshigs drug po dag gis zla ba bcu gnyis la gso sbyong nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod pa las drug ni gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin la /
translated: Six are the fourteenth purification and restoration.

original: bco brgyad ni gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin te /🔽dbyar zla gsum dang ; dgun zla gsum gyi ni ra ba dang / tha chungs mar gyi ngo bco lnga mi thub pas ra ba dang tha chungs kyi gnam stong bzhi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin la /
analyzed: bco brgyad ni gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin te / dbyar zla gsum dang ; dgun zla gsum gyi ni ra ba dang / tha chungs mar gyi ngo bco lnga mi thub pas ra ba dang tha chungs kyi gnam stong bzhi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin la /
translated: Eighteen are the fifteenth purification and restoration.🔽The four days of the fourteenth purification and restoration are the fourteenth of the three months of summer and the fourteenth of the three months of winter, because the fifteenth of the last month of winter cannot be observed.

original: ston zla gsum dang dpyid zla gsum gyi 'bring por mar gyi ngo bco lnga mi thub pas 'bring po'i gnam stong gnyis gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: ston zla gsum dang dpyid zla gsum gyi 'bring por mar gyi ngo bco lnga mi thub pas 'bring po'i gnam stong gnyis gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The two days of the fifteenth purification and restoration are the fifteenth of the three months of autumn and the fifteenth of the three months of spring, because the fifteenth of the last month of spring cannot be observed.

original: @210b lhag ma bco brgyad ni gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: @210b lhag ma bco brgyad ni gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin no //
translated: The remaining eighteen days are the fifteenth day of the confession ceremony.

original: de dag brtsi ba ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zla ba ngo re zhing smyug ma'i thur ma bco lnga skud pa la brgyus pa nyi ma re re bgrang zhing dge skos kyis gnas brtan la brtags te dge 'dun la nyi ma re zhing brjod par bya'o
analyzed: de dag brtsi ba ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis zla ba ngo re zhing smyug ma'i thur ma bco lnga skud pa la brgyus pa nyi ma re re bgrang zhing dge skos kyis gnas brtan la brtags te dge 'dun la nyi ma re zhing brjod par bya'o
translated: The method of counting is as follows: The elder of the saṃgha strings fifteen bamboo sticks and counts one stick each day. The saṃgha’s attendant monk examines the sticks and informs the saṃgha of the day.

original: // zla ba shol dor ba ni rgyal po'i rjes su 'brang bas dor ro //
analyzed: // zla ba shol dor ba ni rgyal po'i rjes su 'brang bas dor ro //
translated: The month is subtracted according to the king.

original: rgyu skar ni skar mkhan gyi rjes su 'brang bas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu skar ni skar mkhan gyi rjes su 'brang bas shes par bya'o //
translated: The lunar mansion is known according to the astrologer.

original: bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / bsdum pa'i gso sbyong dag ni /
analyzed: bkra shis kyi gso sbyong dang / gnod pa byung ba'i gso sbyong dang / bsdum pa'i gso sbyong dag ni /
translated: The confession ceremony of auspiciousness, the confession ceremony of calamity, and the confession ceremony of reconciliation

original: gang gi tshe de dag bya dgos pa de'i tshe bya bar zad kyi dus nges pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag bya dgos pa de'i tshe bya bar zad kyi dus nges pa ni med do //
translated: are performed when they are needed, but there is no fixed time.

original: 'di la dge slong thams cad kyis gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol kho nar gso sbyong ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed kyi ltung ba la so sor brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong thams cad kyis gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol kho nar gso sbyong ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed kyi ltung ba la so sor brtag par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, all monks must examine their downfalls during the fortnight prior to the observance day in the place where the observance is held.

original: ltung ba shes pa bshags pa'am /🔽bsdams pa 'am /
analyzed: ltung ba shes pa bshags pa'am / bsdams pa 'am /
translated: If they know of a downfall, they must confess it🔽or restrain themselves from committing it again

original: byin gyis brlabs pas phyir bcos te las kyi gnas su 'dug par bya'o//
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pas phyir bcos te las kyi gnas su 'dug par bya'o//
translated: or bless themselves.

original: de'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste /🔽ltung byed 'ba' zhig gam /🔽so sor bshags par bya ba'am /
analyzed: de'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di ltar bya ste / ltung byed 'ba' zhig gam / so sor bshags par bya ba'am /
translated: The ritual and the mantra are as follows:🔽If they know of any downfall,🔽any offense that is to be confessed,

original: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas las gang yang rung ba zhig shes na /
analyzed: bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas las gang yang rung ba zhig shes na /
translated: or any offense that is to be confessed and is a minor infraction,

original: des mchil lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: des mchil lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te /
translated: they should remove their two shoes, put their upper robe over one shoulder,

original: dge slong ltung ba mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du rgan pa la phyag 'tshal nas tsog tsog por 'dug ste thal mo sbyar ba btud nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ltung ba mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du rgan pa la phyag 'tshal nas tsog tsog por 'dug ste thal mo sbyar ba btud nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: and bow down to a monk who is not in disagreement with them about the rules. They should then sit in front of him with their palms together and say:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable, please listen!

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba 'di lta bu 'di byung ste /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba 'di lta bu 'di byung ste /
translated: I, the monk so-and-so, have committed such-and-such a downfall.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de dag pa'i mtha' tshun cad nas bzung ste tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de dag pa'i mtha' tshun cad nas bzung ste tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo //
translated: From the time I committed that downfall until now, I have concealed it.

original: 'chags so // mi 'chab bo //
analyzed: 'chags so // mi 'chab bo //
translated: I confess it, I do not conceal it.

original: mthol zhing bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mthol zhing bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If I confess it, I will be comfortable.

original: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If I do not confess it, I will not be comfortable.

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: ” In this way, repeat it twice more.

original: len pas ltung ba mthong ngam zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: len pas ltung ba mthong ngam zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The receiver should say, “Do you see the downfall?”

original: 'chags pas mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chags pas mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The one confessing should say, “I see it.”

original: len pas phyin chad sngom mam zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: len pas phyin chad sngom mam zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The receiver should say, “Will you restrain yourself from now on?”

original: 'chags pas sdom mo zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chags pas sdom mo zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The one confessing should say, “I will restrain myself.”

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: In this way, repeat it twice more.

original: len pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: len pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The receiver should say, “It is proper.”

original: 'chags pas legs so zhes @211a * //
analyzed: 'chags pas legs so zhes @211a * //
translated: The Buddha said, Excellent!🔽🔽

original: brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should say, It is well that you have confessed.

original: de'i tshe dge slong ltung ba la dogs pa dang / yid gnyis za bar gyur na dge slong des dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa dag la dris te ltung ba la dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal nas dge slong gi mdun du chos bzhin du phyir bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong ltung ba la dogs pa dang / yid gnyis za bar gyur na dge slong des dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa dag la dris te ltung ba la dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal nas dge slong gi mdun du chos bzhin du phyir bya'o //
translated: If at that time the monk has doubts and uncertainty about an offense, that monk should ask the monks who uphold the discourses, who uphold the Monastic Law, and who uphold the outlines, and after clearing up his doubts and uncertainty about the offense, he should confess it in the presence of the monks in accordance with the rule.

original: bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas gang yang rung ba zhig shes na rang gi sems kyis bsdam par bya'o //
analyzed: bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas gang yang rung ba zhig shes na rang gi sems kyis bsdam par bya'o //
translated: If he knows of any minor offense that needs to be acknowledged, he should acknowledge it mentally, thinking, I will not do this again.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma dang nyes pa sbom po dang spang ba'i ltung byed kyi ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig shes na byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma dang nyes pa sbom po dang spang ba'i ltung byed kyi ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig shes na byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If he knows of any offense entailing suspension or serious offense or offense entailing acknowledgment, he should seek rehabilitation,

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: and he should do so as follows:

original: des snga ma bzhin du mchi la lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: des snga ma bzhin du mchi la lham gnyis phud nas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu byas te /
translated: He should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder,

original: dge slong ltung ba mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du rgan pa la phyag 'tshal nas tsog tsog pur 'dug ste thal mo sbyar ba btud nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ltung ba mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du rgan pa la phyag 'tshal nas tsog tsog pur 'dug ste thal mo sbyar ba btud nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the presence of a monk who is not in disagreement with him, he should bow down to the feet of the elder, sit down in a humble position, and with palms joined, bow down and say this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable, please pay attention!

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba 'di lta bu 'di byung ste /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la ltung ba 'di lta bu 'di byung ste /
translated: This transgression has arisen for me, the monk named so-and-so.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas deng ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas deng ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong bgyi'o //
translated: Today, in the presence of the Venerable, I, the monk named so-and-so, will confess that transgression and perform the purification.

original: sang nang par ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyi'o //
analyzed: sang nang par ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyi'o //
translated: Tomorrow, I will restore that transgression in accordance with the Dharma.”

original: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: This is repeated a second and a third time.

original: de ni gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol du ltung ba shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba dang / bshags pa dang / bsdam pa dang / byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang sngags so //
analyzed: de ni gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol du ltung ba shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba dang / bshags pa dang / bsdam pa dang / byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang sngags so //
translated: This is the ritual of confession, doubt, confession, restraint, and consecration in the presence of the assembly at the time of purification.

original: mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi cho ga'i skabs nas /
analyzed: mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi cho ga'i skabs nas /
translated: The ritual of purification for those in agreement is as follows:

original: gsol ba byas te so sor thar pa'i mdog don pa sa gso sbyong bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: gsol ba byas te so sor thar pa'i mdog don pa sa gso sbyong bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: Having made a request, one should perform the purification and restoration ceremony by reciting the Pratimoksa Sutra.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi las yin no //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi las yin no //
translated: The recitation of the Pratimoksa Sutra is the duty of the seniormost monk of the community.

original: des mi nus pa nyid yin na gnyis pa'i las yin no //
analyzed: des mi nus pa nyid yin na gnyis pa'i las yin no //
translated: If he is unable to do it, it is the duty of the second most senior monk.

original: des kyang mi nus pa nyid yin na gsum pa'i las yin no //
analyzed: des kyang mi nus pa nyid yin na gsum pa'i las yin no //
translated: If he is unable to do it, it is the duty of the third most senior monk.

original: des kyang mi nus pa nyid yin na thams cad kyis res kyis gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang mi nus pa nyid yin na thams cad kyis res kyis gdon par bya'o //
translated: If he is unable to do it, it is the duty of all the monks in turn.

original: res 'bab pa'i tshe 'das mi nus na gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: res 'bab pa'i tshe 'das mi nus na gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If the one who is due to recite the Pratimoksa Sutra is unable to do so, he should ask someone else to do it.

original: des ma btub na dge 'dun gyis de la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: des ma btub na dge 'dun gyis de la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If the one asked is unable to do it, the community should ask him.

original: 'don pa de dag gis tshig phyed kyang ma 'khrul bar legs par thon pa de nyid yin na gdon gyi gzhan du na mi 'chags so //
analyzed: 'don pa de dag gis tshig phyed kyang ma 'khrul bar legs par thon pa de nyid yin na gdon gyi gzhan du na mi 'chags so //
translated: If the recitation is done well, without error, even if only half the text is recited, it is considered to be done. Otherwise, it is not considered to be done.

original: 'don pa'i tshe rdungs na lhag ma gzhan gyis @211b gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: 'don pa'i tshe rdungs na lhag ma gzhan gyis @211b gdon par bya'o //
translated: If the recitation is interrupted by a noise, the remainder should be recited by another.

original: dum bu 'dzin pa nyid yin na ji snyed kyis gzhung bsrangs pa de snyed kyis pheg tu phyed du bcad de gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: dum bu 'dzin pa nyid yin na ji snyed kyis gzhung bsrangs pa de snyed kyis pheg tu phyed du bcad de gdon par bya'o //
translated: If it is held in parts, then it should be recited by dividing it into as many parts as there are people reciting it.

original: 'don par byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i gsol ba ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'don par byed pas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i gsol ba ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: The one who recites should make a request to recite the Sūtra of Individual Liberation like this:

original: mdo 'don pa seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa dang ; dus dang por bya ba dag je bton nas /
analyzed: mdo 'don pa seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa dang ; dus dang por bya ba dag je bton nas /
translated: Having sat on the lion throne to recite the sūtra, and having recited the Sūtra of Individual Liberation and the duties of the first period,

original: de'i 'og tu gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las bya'o //
translated: after that, only the request should be done.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: It should be done like this:

original: seng ge'i khri la 'dug bzhin du 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: seng ge'i khri la 'dug bzhin du 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: While sitting on the lion throne, it should be said like this:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /🔽deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa 'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol / deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bcu bzhi pa 'am /
translated: Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: bco lnga pa ste ;
analyzed: bco lnga pa ste ;
translated: Today is the fourteenth or fifteenth of the Saṅgha's Poṣadha.🔽If it is the right time for the Saṅgha and the Saṅgha accepts it, then may the Saṅgha approve it.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong mdzad de so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon to //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong mdzad de so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon to //
translated: Today the Saṅgha will perform Poṣadha and recite the Sūtra of Individual Liberation.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the request.

original: de ltar gsol ba byas nas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par gyur pa gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa dag gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsol ba byas nas so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa rnam pa lnga po gleng gzhi gdon pa dang / pham par gyur pa gdon pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa dang / ma nges pa gdon pa dang / ril gyis gdon pa dag gdon par bya'o //
translated: Having made the request in this way, the five-part recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra should be recited: the recitation of the introduction, the recitation of the offenses entailing expulsion, the recitation of the offenses entailing suspension, the recitation of the undetermined offenses, and the recitation of the remaining topics.

original: de la gleng gzhi gdon pa ni rdzogs pa kho nar mi gdon du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de la gleng gzhi gdon pa ni rdzogs pa kho nar mi gdon du mi rung ngo //
translated: In this regard, the recitation of the introduction should not be omitted.

original: gleng gzhi bton nas lhag ma rnams ni thos pa bsgrags pas sgrub tu rung ngo //🔽de yang gleng gzhi bton nas pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa brtsams na pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
analyzed: gleng gzhi bton nas lhag ma rnams ni thos pa bsgrags pas sgrub tu rung ngo // de yang gleng gzhi bton nas pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa brtsams na pham par 'gyur ba'i sde tshan rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
translated: Having recited the introduction, the remaining topics are established by proclaiming what has been heard.🔽Moreover, having recited the introduction, if one begins the recitation of the offenses entailing expulsion, the entire class of offenses entailing expulsion must be recited.

original: pham par 'gyur ba bton nas dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa brtsams na dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan yang rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba bton nas dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa brtsams na dge 'dun lhag ma'i sde tshan yang rdzogs par gdon dgos so //
translated: Having recited the offenses entailing expulsion, if one begins the recitation of the offenses entailing suspension, the entire class of offenses entailing suspension must also be recited.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma bton nas ma nges pa gdon pa brtsams nas ma nges pa'i sde tshan yang rdzogs par gdon dgos te /🔽pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ma nges pa yan chad kyi sde tshan ni gdon par mgo brtsams na gang brtsams pa'i sde tshan de nyid rdzogs par bya dgos so //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma bton nas ma nges pa gdon pa brtsams nas ma nges pa'i sde tshan yang rdzogs par gdon dgos te / pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dang / ma nges pa yan chad kyi sde tshan ni gdon par mgo brtsams na gang brtsams pa'i sde tshan de nyid rdzogs par bya dgos so //
translated: Having recited the remaining defeats, one should begin reciting the undetermined offenses, and one should recite the undetermined class in its entirety.🔽If one begins reciting the class of offenses that are a basis for defeat, the remaining defeats, the undetermined class, and so on, one must complete the class that one began.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed man chad kyi sde tshan ni gdon par mgo brtsams na lhag ma so sor thar pa'i gzhung thams cad rdzogs par gdon dgos te /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed man chad kyi sde tshan ni gdon par mgo brtsams na lhag ma so sor thar pa'i gzhung thams cad rdzogs par gdon dgos te /
translated: If one begins reciting the class of offenses that are a basis for partial defeat and so on, one must complete the recitation of the entire text of the Pratimoksha, the remainder.

original: ril gyis gdon pa zhes bya ba yang de yin no //🔽mgo brtsams pa'i sde tshan de nyid rdzogs par bya dgos pa de dag @212a * //
analyzed: ril gyis gdon pa zhes bya ba yang de yin no // mgo brtsams pa'i sde tshan de nyid rdzogs par bya dgos pa de dag @212a * //
translated: This is also called “reciting the entire text.”

original: ma rdzogs na mi 'chags so //
analyzed: ma rdzogs na mi 'chags so //
translated: If one does not complete the class that one began, one’s recitation is not complete.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'dron lam du 'gro la 'dron pa don mthun pa dag sdod du mi btub na 'gro bzhin du gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'dron lam du 'gro la 'dron pa don mthun pa dag sdod du mi btub na 'gro bzhin du gdon par bya ste /
translated: If one is traveling on a dangerous road and one’s companions will not wait, one should recite the Pratimoksha while walking.

original: 'di'i las ni 'dug pa nyid kyis bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i las ni 'dug pa nyid kyis bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: The action of this is to be done by sitting, as is stated in the Tipitaka.

original: sgra mi 'dod na mdor bsdus te gdon no //
analyzed: sgra mi 'dod na mdor bsdus te gdon no //
translated: If one does not want to recite it, one should recite the summary.

original: de tsam yang mi 'dod na byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam yang mi 'dod na byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If one does not want even that much, one should bless oneself.

original: chos ma yin pas 'don na mi 'chags te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pas 'don na mi 'chags te /
translated: If one recites it incorrectly, it is not recited.

original: gdon par bya ba dang / de'i tshad dang / dus dang / gdon par byed pa rnams de kho na bzhin nye par ma bzung ba ni 'dir chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gdon par bya ba dang / de'i tshad dang / dus dang / gdon par byed pa rnams de kho na bzhin nye par ma bzung ba ni 'dir chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: Here, incorrect is not taking up exactly the recitation, its measure, time, and reciter.

original: gdon par bya ba de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las gzhan pa phran tshogs la sogs pa gdon pa'o //
analyzed: gdon par bya ba de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las gzhan pa phran tshogs la sogs pa gdon pa'o //
translated: Not taking up exactly the recitation is reciting the Ksudraka-vastu and so on, other than the Pratimoksha Sutra.

original: de'i tshad de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gleng gzhi mi 'don zhing lhag ma rnams kyang thos pa bsgrags pas sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshad de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gleng gzhi mi 'don zhing lhag ma rnams kyang thos pa bsgrags pas sgrub par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not taking up exactly its measure is not reciting the nidana and not establishing the remainder by proclaiming the hearing.

original: de'i dus de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gso sbyong gi dus las gzhan pa'i dus su 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dus de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gso sbyong gi dus las gzhan pa'i dus su 'dod pa'o //
translated: Not holding to the exact time means not holding to the time of the purification and restoration ceremony, but to some other time.

original: 'don par byed pa de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gang zag bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang mtshan dang lta ba dang tshul khrims dang lta ba mthun pa dag las gzhan pas 'don pa'o //
analyzed: 'don par byed pa de kho na bzhin nye bar ma bzung ba ni gang zag bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang mtshan dang lta ba dang tshul khrims dang lta ba mthun pa dag las gzhan pas 'don pa'o //
translated: Not holding to the exact recitation means that the recitation is done by someone other than those who are fully ordained, who have the same view and the same ethical conduct.

original: de ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i cho ga dang las so ;
analyzed: de ni so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i cho ga dang las so ;
translated: This is the ritual procedure for reciting the Sūtra of Individual Liberation and its actions.

original: / mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi cho ga'i skabs nas gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi nang du ltung ba dran na des ltung ba de dge slong drung na mo la byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar
analyzed: / mthun pa'i gso sbyong gi cho ga'i skabs nas gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi nang du ltung ba dran na des ltung ba de dge slong drung na mo la byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar
translated: In the section on the ritual of the purification and restoration ceremony in agreement, it is said, “On that very fifteenth day of purification and restoration, if a fully ordained monk remembers an offense in the midst of the saṅgha, he should confess that offense to the fully ordained monk who is closest to him.”🔽This is how it should be done:

original: bya ste / des dge slong drung na 'dug pa'i mdun du tsog tsog pur 'dug ste /
analyzed: bya ste / des dge slong drung na 'dug pa'i mdun du tsog tsog pur 'dug ste /
translated: The monk should sit in front of the fully ordained monk who is closest to him,

original: thal mo sbyar ba btud nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba btud nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: bow with palms joined, and say this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: “Venerable, please listen!

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
translated: Today is the fifteenth day of the purification and confession of the saṅgha.

translated: Tomorrow morning I will ask the monks who uphold the sūtras, uphold the vinaya, and uphold the mātṛkā, and having cleared up my doubts and uncertainty, I will restore that downfall in accordance with the Dharma.

analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa yin la /

analyzed: bdag dge slong las byed pa ming 'di zhes bya ba dge 'dun gyi nang du ltung ba 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig dran te /
translated: In the midst of the community, I, the presiding officer monk named so-and-so, remember this and that infraction.

analyzed: bdag dge slong las byed pa ming 'di zhes bya bas deng ltung ba de rang gi sems kyis byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong bya'o //
translated: Today, I, the presiding officer monk named so-and-so, will perform the confession ceremony by mentally confessing that infraction.”

analyzed: sang nang par ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir bya'o zhes lan cig brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: de ni las byed pa'i dge 'dun gyi nang du ltung ba dran pa byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang sngags so //
translated: This is the ritual and mantra for the monk who is the caretaker of the rules to bless the memory of downfalls in the midst of the saṅgha.

analyzed: de nyid kyi skabs nas gso sbyong bco lnga pa de @213a * //

analyzed: nyid dge slong las byed pas dge 'dun gyi nang du ltung ba la yid gnyis dang bcas par gyur na des ltung ba de rang gi sems kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: “If on that very fifteenth day of the ritual of restoration and purification, the monk who is the caretaker of the rules has doubts about a downfall, he should bless his mind with regard to that downfall.”🔽This is how it is done:

translated: While sitting, he should say to himself,🔽“Today is the fifteenth day of the ritual of restoration and purification of the saṅgha.

analyzed: bdag dge slong las byed pa ming 'di zhes bya ba'i gso sbyong yang bco lnga pa yin te /
translated: Today is also the fifteenth day of my, the monk named so-and-so, ritual of restoration and purification.

original: bdag dge slong las byed pa ming 'di zhes bya ba dge 'dun gyi nang du ltung ba 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig la yid gnyis su gyur na bdag dge slong las byed pa ming 'di zhes bya bas deng ltung ba de rang gi sems kyis byin gyis🔽brlabs te gso sbyong bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dge slong las byed pa ming 'di zhes bya ba dge 'dun gyi nang du ltung ba 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig la yid gnyis su gyur na bdag dge slong las byed pa ming 'di zhes bya bas deng ltung ba de rang gi sems kyis byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong bya'o //
translated: The monk official named so-and-so, in the midst of the saṅgha, has doubts about this and that downfall. The monk official named so-and-so, today, will bless his own mind with that downfall and will perform the poṣadha.

original: sang nang bar dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal la ltung ba de chos bzhin phyir bya'o zhes lan cig brjod par bya'o//
analyzed: sang nang bar dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal la ltung ba de chos bzhin phyir bya'o zhes lan cig brjod par bya'o//
translated: Tomorrow, in the morning, he will ask the monks who hold the sūtras, who hold the vinaya, and who hold the mātṛkā, and will clear up his doubts and his two minds. He will then confess that downfall in accordance with the Dharma.”

original: de ni las byed pa dge 'dun gyi nang du lhung ba la yid gnyis dang bcas par gyur pa byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang sngags so //
analyzed: de ni las byed pa dge 'dun gyi nang du lhung ba la yid gnyis dang bcas par gyur pa byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang sngags so //
translated: This is the ritual and the mantra for blessing the monk official who has a doubt in the midst of the saṅgha.

original: de nyid kyi skabs nas gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba mthun pa dang bcas par gyur na dge slong de rnams kyis gang gi mdun du de rnams ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir bya ba'i dge slong 'ga' zhig gnas
analyzed: de nyid kyi skabs nas gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba mthun pa dang bcas par gyur na dge slong de rnams kyis gang gi mdun du de rnams ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir bya ba'i dge slong 'ga' zhig gnas
translated: The same text states:

analyzed: gzhan du song la dge slong gi mdun du ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir byed pa de lta bu spro bar bya'o //
translated: If on that fifteenth day of the confession ceremony all members of the community have incurred the same downfall, then those monks should send one of their number to another place, to a monk in whose presence they can purify that downfall in accordance with the teaching.

original: gal te 'grub na de lta na legs ci ste mi 'grub na dge slong de rnams kyis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'grub na de lta na legs ci ste mi 'grub na dge slong de rnams kyis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If that is possible, then that is good. If not, then those monks should perform the consecration ritual with a proposal alone.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it should be done:

original: gal te gso sbyong gi dus su dge 'dun thams cad kyi ltung ba mthun pa dang bcas par shes par gyur na dge slong gcig mtshams gzhan gyi dge slong gi drung du btang ste /
analyzed: gal te gso sbyong gi dus su dge 'dun thams cad kyi ltung ba mthun pa dang bcas par shes par gyur na dge slong gcig mtshams gzhan gyi dge slong gi drung du btang ste /
translated: If, on the day of the confession ceremony, it is discovered that all members of the community have incurred the same downfall, then one monk should be sent to another place, to a monk in whose presence they can purify that downfall in accordance with the teaching.

original: des der ltung ba dran pa phyir bcos phyir 'ongs nas de'i mdun tu thams cad kyis ltung ba shes pa phyir bcos te gso sbyong bya'o //
analyzed: des der ltung ba dran pa phyir bcos phyir 'ongs nas de'i mdun tu thams cad kyis ltung ba shes pa phyir bcos te gso sbyong bya'o //
translated: If he remembers that he has committed a downfall, he should confess it and return.

original: gal te cho ga de ma grub na dge slong gcig gis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te cho ga de ma grub na dge slong gcig gis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If the ceremony is not completed, a single monk should consecrate the ceremony by performing the announcement alone.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it is done.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The monk should sit down and say:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan @213b du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan @213b du gsol /
translated: “Venerables, please listen!

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /
translated: Today is the fifteenth day of the confession ceremony for the saṅgha.

original: bdag cag dge 'dun thams cad ni ltung ba dang bcas par gyur na /🔽gang gi mdun du bdag cag ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyi ba bdag cag las dge slong gnas gzhan du mchis la /
analyzed: bdag cag dge 'dun thams cad ni ltung ba dang bcas par gyur na / gang gi mdun du bdag cag ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyi ba bdag cag las dge slong gnas gzhan du mchis la /
translated: Since all of us in the saṅgha have downfalls,🔽we should confess them in the presence of someone and then amend them in accordance with the Dharma.

original: dge slong gi mdun du ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyid par spro ba su yang ma mchis na /
analyzed: dge slong gi mdun du ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyid par spro ba su yang ma mchis na /
translated: But none of us is willing to go to another monastery and confess our downfalls there in the presence of a monk.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis deng ltung ba de byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong mdzad la /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis deng ltung ba de byin gyis brlabs te gso sbyong mdzad la /
translated: If the time is right for the Saṅgha and it is agreeable, then the Saṅgha should agree to the Saṅgha’s consecration of that downfall and the purification of the confession.

original: slad kyi dge slong gi mdun du ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar mdzad do //
analyzed: slad kyi dge slong gi mdun du ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar mdzad do //
translated: Later, in the presence of the monks, that downfall should be confessed in accordance with the Dharma.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o //
translated: This is the motion.

original: de ni gso sbyong gi dus su dge 'dun thams cad kyis ltung ba mthun par shes pa byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang las so //
analyzed: de ni gso sbyong gi dus su dge 'dun thams cad kyis ltung ba mthun par shes pa byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga dang las so //
translated: This is the ritual and the rite for the consecration of the confession of downfalls that are recognized as the same by the entire Saṅgha at the time of the purification of the confession.

original: de nyid kyi skabs nas gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba la yid gnyis dang bcas par gyur na dge slong de rnams kyis gang gi mdun du de rnams ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir bya ba'i dge slong 'ga' zhig🔽gnas gzhan du song la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi skabs nas gso sbyong bco lnga pa de nyid la dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba la yid gnyis dang bcas par gyur na dge slong de rnams kyis gang gi mdun du de rnams ltung ba de chos bzhin du phyir bya ba'i dge slong 'ga' zhig🔽gnas gzhan du song la /
translated: In that very context, if on that very fifteenth day of the purification of the confession all the members of the Saṅgha have doubts about a downfall, then those monks should go to another place.

original: dge slong mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te ltung ba la yid gnyis bsal nas chos bzhin du phyir byed pa de lta bu spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te ltung ba la yid gnyis bsal nas chos bzhin du phyir byed pa de lta bu spro bar bya'o //
translated: He should ask the monks who are experts in the discourses, the monastic code, and the scriptures, and should resolve his doubts about the precepts according to the Dharma. He should be enthusiastic about making amends in this way.

original: gal te 'grub na de lta na legs /
analyzed: gal te 'grub na de lta na legs /
translated: If the monk is able to do this, then it is good.

original: ci ste mi 'grub na dge slong de rnams kyis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste mi 'grub na dge slong de rnams kyis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: If he is not able to do this, then the monks should give their consent by means of a single proclamation.

original: gal te gso sbyong gi dus su dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba la yid gnyis dang bcas par gyur na dge slong cig mtshams gzhan gyi dge slong mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa rnams kyi drung du btang ste /
analyzed: gal te gso sbyong gi dus su dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba la yid gnyis dang bcas par gyur na dge slong cig mtshams gzhan gyi dge slong mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa rnams kyi drung du btang ste /
translated: If on the purification day all the members of the saṅgha are uncertain about their downfalls, then one monk should be sent to a saṅgha in another region that is made up of monks who are experts in the sūtras, the vinaya, and the mātṛkā.

original: des der ltung ba la dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal te phyir 'ongs nas de'i mdun du thams cad kyis ltung ba la yid gnyis dang bcas par gyur pa bsal te gso sbyong bya'o ;
analyzed: des der ltung ba la dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal te phyir 'ongs nas de'i mdun du thams cad kyis ltung ba la yid gnyis dang bcas par gyur pa bsal te gso sbyong bya'o ;
translated: That monk should go there and clear up his doubts and uncertainties about the downfalls. When he returns, all the monks should clear up their doubts and uncertainties about the downfalls in his presence and then do the purification.

original: gal te cho ga de ma grub na dge slong gcig gis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gis las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te cho ga de ma grub na dge slong gcig gis gsol ba 'ba' zhig gis las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If that rite is not accomplished, a single monk should consecrate the action with a request alone.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: It is done like this.

original: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Sitting down, he should say this:

analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: “Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la /🔽bdag @214a * //
analyzed: deng dge 'dun gyi gso sbyong bco lnga pa lags la / bdag @214a * //
translated: Today is the fifteenth poṣadha of the saṅgha.🔽If we all

analyzed: cag dge 'dun thams cad ltung ba la dogs pa dang yid gnyis dang bcas par gyur na /
translated: have doubts and uncertainties about downfalls,🔽in front of whom should we restore that downfall according to the Dharma?

original: gang gi mdun du bdag cag ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyi ba bdag cag las dge slong gnas gzhan du mchis la /
analyzed: gang gi mdun du bdag cag ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyi ba bdag cag las dge slong gnas gzhan du mchis la /
translated: Since we are not able to do that, a monk from our saṅgha has gone to another place.

original: dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal la ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyid par spro ba su yang ma mchis na gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang /
analyzed: dge slong mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams la dris te dogs pa dang yid gnyis bsal la ltung ba de chos bzhin du slar bgyid par spro ba su yang ma mchis na gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang /
translated: If there is no one who is willing to ask the monks who uphold the sūtras, who uphold the vinaya, and who uphold the mātṛkā, and to clear up their doubts and uncertainties and to confess that downfall in accordance with the Dharma, then if it seems appropriate to the saṅgha and they accept it, then
